statements: UPSERT INTO LegalDocuments (document_id, document_name, document_type, document_content, created_date) VALUES (1, 'Document 1', 'Type A', 'Content A', '2022-01-01')

UPSERT INTO LegalDocuments (document_id, document_name, document_type, document_content, created_date) VALUES (3, 'Document 3', 'Type C', 'Content C', '2022-01-03')
UPSERT INTO LegalCases (case_id, case_name, case_description) VALUES (1, 'Case 1', 'Description 1')
UPSERT INTO Lawyers (lawyer_id, lawyer_name, specialization) VALUES (1, 'Lawyer 1', 'Specialization 1')
UPSERT INTO LegalCases (case_id, case_name, case_description) VALUES (2, 'Case 2', 'Description 2')
UPSERT INTO lawyers (id, name) VALUES (1, 'John Doe');
UPSERT INTO clients (id, name, lawyer_id) VALUES (1, 'Client 1', 1);
UPSERT INTO cases (id, case_number, client_id) VALUES (1, 12345, 1);
UPSERT INTO clients (client_id, client_name, client_address) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', '123 Main Street')
UPSERT INTO clients (client_id, client_name, client_address) VALUES (2, 'Jane Smith', '456 Elm Street')
UPSERT INTO clients (client_id, client_name, client_address) VALUES (3, 'Mike Johnson', '789 Oak Street')
INSERT INTO lawyer (id, name, address) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', '123 Main St') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE name = 'John Doe', address = '123 Main St'
INSERT INTO client (id, name, address) VALUES (1, 'Jane Smith', '456 Elm St') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE name = 'Jane Smith', address = '456 Elm St'
INSERT INTO case (case_id, case_name, lawyer_id, client_id) VALUES (1, 'Case One', 1, 1) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE case_name = 'Case One', lawyer_id = 1, client_id = 1
